page.title: 05ATTITUDES OF PEOPLE IN CURY
page.content: The people in the area did not want too much change. It appeared that what was going on in the rest of the world did not really affect them, though they were naturally concerned about tragic events. They were quite happy with their own way of life and felt that they were out of the 'rat race'. They wanted life as it is and has been for many years to continue in the same way. They were not too concerned about the lack of amenities in the area as this went with their quiet way of life, though some people would like some more shops. One person summed the general attitude when he stated that 'He didn't want the world to discover Gunwalloe'. Meaning he wanted it to remain a quiet rural and pleasant area.
